Class Environment

  • java.lang.Object
    • Environment

  • public class Environment
extends java.lang.Object
    This class manages the state of the Scoreboard, Clock, and PlayingField objects. It also handles player visual feedback during Mallet strikes by maintaining a list and array of ScoreBubble objects.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Environment()
      Creates a new scoreboard, clock, playingField, ArrayList of ScoreBubble objects for positive hits, and 2-dimensional array for ScoreBubble objects that are fminuses.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.awt.Image getBackground() 
      Clock getClock() 
      ScoreBubble[][] getFMinuses() 
      java.awt.Image getInstructions() 
      PlayingField getPlayingField() 
      Scoreboard getScoreboard() 
      java.util.ArrayList getScoreBubbles() 
      void killMole(Mole mole)
      This method updates the score according to what type of mole was passed in as a parameter.
      void updateEnvironment(long elapsedTime)
      This method updates all of the objects under the control of the environment including the scoreboard, the clock, and the playingField (which holds the moles).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Environment

        public Environment()
        Creates a new scoreboard, clock, playingField, ArrayList of ScoreBubble objects for positive hits, and 2-dimensional array for ScoreBubble objects that are fminuses. Additionally, the background and instruction images are loaded.

    • Method Detail

      • killMole

        public void killMole(Mole mole)
        This method updates the score according to what type of mole was passed in as a parameter. It also adds positive scoreBubbles to the Environment class's ArrayList, giving them the location of the mole being killed. Finally, the playingField's killMole method is invoked passing the mole parameter through.
        Parameters:
        mole - a mole in the game that is to be terminated

      • getScoreboard

        public Scoreboard getScoreboard()
        Returns:
        the player's current score

      • getClock

        public Clock getClock()
        Returns:
        the object that keeps track of how much time is left

      • getPlayingField

        public PlayingField getPlayingField()
        Returns:
        the playingField which contains all the moles

      • getBackground

        public java.awt.Image getBackground()
        Returns:
        the background image for the program

      • getInstructions

        public java.awt.Image getInstructions()
        Returns:
        the badge that contains the instructions for the sidebar

      • getScoreBubbles

        public java.util.ArrayList getScoreBubbles()
        Returns:
        the list of positive scorebubbles that are floating on the screen

      • getFMinuses

        public ScoreBubble[][] getFMinuses()
        Returns:
        the array of professors giving you an f minus

      • updateEnvironment

        public void updateEnvironment(long elapsedTime)
        This method updates all of the objects under the control of the environment including the scoreboard, the clock, and the playingField (which holds the moles). It also runs through and checks which scorebubbles need to be removed from the game field.
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - the amount of time that has passed since the last iteration of the program loop
